repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
fix #36423 

Problem:
In scripts/genappimage.sh running on arm64 host, the $ARCH will be set to 'arm64' before calling linuxdeploy, which cause linuxdeploy to generate an 32bit ELF executable instead 64bit. See the [issue](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/36423) for more details. 

Solution:
Keep $ARCH unchanged, use $ARCH_OUTPUT in the output file name. On arm64 host, $ARCH_OUTPUT will be converted to 'arm64'.

comment_data.body:
since you set ARCH_OUTPUT=ARCH above, seems clearer to check ARCH_OUTPUT here?
```suggestion
if [[ "$ARCH_OUTPUT" == 'aarch64' ]]; then
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,28 +78,28 @@ cd "$APP_BUILD_DIR" || exit # Get out of AppImage directory.
 
 # We want to be consistent, so always use arm64 over aarch64
 if [[ "$ARCH" == 'aarch64' ]]; then

comment_data.body: Both are fine. Before this test,  $ARCH and $ARCH_OUTPUT are the same value. If on arm64 host, ARCH_OUTPUT should be changed to 'arm64' to follow the naming convention of packaing, while $ARCH  still keeps untouched with value 'aarch64', because $ARCH must be 'aarch64' for linuxdeploy to generate the correct 64-bit ELF executable.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,28 +78,28 @@ cd "$APP_BUILD_DIR" || exit # Get out of AppImage directory.
 
 # We want to be consistent, so always use arm64 over aarch64
 if [[ "$ARCH" == 'aarch64' ]]; then

comment_data.body: Yes, the suggestion is for clarity of purpose.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,28 +78,28 @@ cd "$APP_BUILD_DIR" || exit # Get out of AppImage directory.
 
 # We want to be consistent, so always use arm64 over aarch64
 if [[ "$ARCH" == 'aarch64' ]]; then

comment_data.body: we don't need to "export" this, right? can drop this line.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -77,29 +77,29 @@ chmod 755 AppRun
 cd "$APP_BUILD_DIR" || exit # Get out of AppImage directory.
 
 # We want to be consistent, so always use arm64 over aarch64
-if [[ "$ARCH" == 'aarch64' ]]; then
-  ARCH="arm64"
-  export ARCH
+if [[ "$ARCH_OUTPUT" == 'aarch64' ]]; then
+  ARCH_OUTPUT="arm64"
+  export ARCH_OUTPUT

@@ -77,29 +77,29 @@ chmod 755 AppRun
 cd "$APP_BUILD_DIR" || exit # Get out of AppImage directory.
 
 # We want to be consistent, so always use arm64 over aarch64
-if [[ "$ARCH" == 'aarch64' ]]; then
-  ARCH="arm64"
-  export ARCH
+if [[ "$ARCH_OUTPUT" == 'aarch64' ]]; then
+  ARCH_OUTPUT="arm64"
+  export ARCH_OUTPUT

@@ -77,29 +77,28 @@ chmod 755 AppRun
 cd "$APP_BUILD_DIR" || exit # Get out of AppImage directory.
 
 # We want to be consistent, so always use arm64 over aarch64
-if [[ "$ARCH" == 'aarch64' ]]; then
-  ARCH="arm64"
-  export ARCH
+if [[ "$ARCH_OUTPUT" == 'aarch64' ]]; then

@@ -78,28 +78,27 @@ cd "$APP_BUILD_DIR" || exit # Get out of AppImage directory.
 
 # We want to be consistent, so always use arm64 over aarch64
 if [[ "$ARCH" == 'aarch64' ]]; then

title: fix(appimage): wrong $ARCH used by linuxdeploy
